title: I'm confused by Chapter 6 of the Great Gatsby, can someone help me understand what happens in Chapter 6? - Quora

response.answer_text: Nick interrupts the story of Gatsby to reveal some of the truth of Gatsby, his real name, the fact that he worked for a rich man named Cody who was drunk most of the time. He brings us back to the present when he relates how Gatsby met up with Tom and the Sloanes who politely invite him to dinner, but Gatsby doesn’t understand their insincerity in the invitation. Later, Tom and Daisy are at a party at Gatsby’s and Nick relates that there’s something less enticing about this party and Gatsby reveals his desire to have Daisy. Re-read the chapter and answer these questions: What do we learn about Jay Gatz?What does Jay Gatz learn from working for Cody?How does working for Cody change Gatsby?How does Gatsby act when he meets Tom and the Sloanes? Why does he act that way?What does the invitation from Tom and the others say about them? Is it obvious that they don’t really mean what they say? Why doesn’t gatsby see that?How does Nick see Gatsby’s party? Why is Tom there?How does Gatsby think he’ll get Daisy? Is that realistic?What is Gatsby’s dream? What does Nick think of the dream?What are the rumors about Gatsby?
